channel.title: Flat earth?
channel.description: No, it's round. Can we have some half-intelligent people go to [url=http://theflatearthsociety.org/forums]here[/url] and just shut these guys up? Especially BobDole, because he is a genius.

item.title: Flat earth?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Whiskey:

This made me…angry. How can people be so stupid:

Read the thread on how they guard the ice wall. In the FAQ they said, “It can be done with basic equipment.” And in the linked thread, it shows how you need apaches and cruise missiles. It’s quite amusing.

Read full topic

item.title: Flat earth?
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

[quote=“Whiskey, post:16, topic:60114”]This made me…angry. How can people be so stupid:

[quote]Q: “Why do the all the world Governments say the Earth is round?”

A: It’s a conspiracy

Q: “What about NASA? Don’t they have photos to prove that the Earth is round?”

A: NASA is part of the conspiracy too. The photos are faked.

Q: “Why has no-one taken a photo of the Earth that proves it is flat?”

A: The government prevents people from getting close enough to the Ice Wall to take a picture.

Q: “How did NASA create these images with the computer technology available at the time?”

A: Since NASA did not send rockets into space, they instead spent the money on developing advanced computers and imaging software instead[/quote][/quote]

Wow, I never new people could act so retarded…

Read full topic

item.title: Flat earth?
item.dc:creator: @Whiskey Whiskey
item.description:
@Whiskey wrote:

This made me…angry. How can people be so stupid:

Q: "Why do the all the world Governments say the Earth is round?"

A: It’s a conspiracy

Q: “What about NASA? Don’t they have photos to prove that the Earth is round?”

A: NASA is part of the conspiracy too. The photos are faked.

Q: “Why has no-one taken a photo of the Earth that proves it is flat?”

A: The government prevents people from getting close enough to the Ice Wall to take a picture.

Q: “How did NASA create these images with the computer technology available at the time?”

A: Since NASA did not send rockets into space, they instead spent the money on developing advanced computers and imaging software instead

Read full topic

item.title: Flat earth?
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

“1500 years ago, everybody knew that Earth was the center of the universe. 500 years ago, everybody knew that Earth was flat and 15 minutes ago you knew humans were alone on this planet. Imagine what you’ll know tomorrow…”

I found this quote very funny because it’s true (not sure about the aliens tho! ). Humans have “known” all kind of things in the past, and oh boy we laugh at them how they were stupid. What do you think humans in future will do, when they find out that we tough you couldn’t heal cancer?

Back to the topic, haha made me smile a bit

Read full topic

Then again i also belive that the earth rotates to the left and nothing is moving but the universe is moving around the objects using a central field of gravity coming from the center of the universe where there used to be a cluseter of 100 stars that imploded and now has an amazing amout of force pulling and pushing objects in space.

item.title: Flat earth?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:11, topic:60114”][quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=86431.msg920762#msg920762 date=1171964200]
Who knows, maybe the Earth is flat…maybe they’re thinking on the right track and we’re all following false, deceiving views of the universe. After all, Einstein himself said that “Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius – and a lot of courage – to move in the opposite direction.”

But I believe in scientific fact and theory based on observational evidence…and there is none for the flat earth model. But hey, people tend to believe and blindly follow all sorts of stuff. I don’t think any one of us can change their minds.
[/quote]
I agree, however these people think it is a conspiracy by the government. They think the government rigs the cameras and pictures of the earth. They even say that because our eyes are round, we cannot see if the world is round. Reading through the posts, many people have a “prove that it’s not flat” attitude, then when someone does with loads of info, all the other people can say “Omg your just posting info on the government’s conspiracy!”[/quote]

Heh, quite true, I noticed that as well. Their reasoning is just a bit too radical for me…I mean, couldn’t the government make more money selling tours or something to see the Ice Wall and beyond than they would keeping it a secret?

Read full topic

item.title: Flat earth?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:8, topic:60114”]Who knows, maybe the Earth is flat…maybe they’re thinking on the right track and we’re all following false, deceiving views of the universe. After all, Einstein himself said that “Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius – and a lot of courage – to move in the opposite direction.”

But I believe in scientific fact and theory based on observational evidence…and there is none for the flat earth model. But hey, people tend to believe and blindly follow all sorts of stuff. I don’t think any one of us can change their minds.[/quote]
I agree, however these people think it is a conspiracy by the government. They think the government rigs the cameras and pictures of the earth. They even say that because our eyes are round, we cannot see if the world is round. Reading through the posts, many people have a “prove that it’s not flat” attitude, then when someone does with loads of info, all the other people can say “Omg your just posting info on the government’s conspiracy!”

Read full topic

item.title: Flat earth?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Who knows, maybe the Earth is flat…maybe they’re thinking on the right track and we’re all following false, deceiving views of the universe. After all, Einstein himself said that “Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius – and a lot of courage – to move in the opposite direction.”

But I believe in scientific fact and theory based on observational evidence…and there is none for the flat earth model. But hey, people tend to believe and blindly follow all sorts of stuff. I don’t think any one of us can change their minds.

Read full topic
